title: Anagrams
subtitle: Find words from jumbled letters
description: Enter your letters and the app will search for any words that are composed of those letters. The app will first find complete anagrams that use all of the letters and then sub-anagrams which use some of the letters, any unused letters will appear in brackets.
advanced:
Scrabble players can use the Contains Word or Pattern filters to fit their letters on the board.

For example, enter your rack letters and the word on the board you want to extend off, press search, press the filters button, in the Contains Word filter enter the board word and finally press search again.

title: Crossw.rds
subtitle: Use dots for unknown letters
description:
As you fill out a crossword you can find answers to a clue when you have some of the clue's letters.

Press . for unknown letters and type in any known letters in the order they appear.
advanced:
Consonants, especially JKMQWXZ are really good for narrowing down the number of matches. Depending on the clue you can guess the ending of a word, try: s, ed or ing.

A cryptic clue may give you some of the letters, use the Contains filter to narrow down the search.

title: Blank Letters+
subtitle: Use + as a blank letter
description:
For anagrams you can specify a wildcard letter using + which can be any letter. This is useful for Scrabble (use + for the blank tile) and cases where you know most of the letters in a jumbled word.

Tip! Blank letters will be highlighted as a different colour.
advanced:
You can use + more than once,
eg +++ for 3 blank letters, be careful though as the app will find lots of matches - up to 5000!

Use filters to reduce the number of results found, the Pattern filter is useful if you can fix the position of certain letters. Use the Equal To filter to find words of a certain length.

title: Two Word Anagrams
subtitle: Use a space to split the letters
description:
The app has a built in list of 100,000 phrases, it will search this list first trying to match all of your letters to a phrase. Next the app will search it's word list and try to match your letters to a group of random words.

In the example james bond, the space splits the letters into two words of length 4 and 5 letters. The app will find 4 and 5 letter words whose combined letters make up jamesbond.

Further more the app will search for other size combinations, eg 3-6, 2-7

Since 'james bond' is in the phrase list, this result will be shown first
advanced: The app will also perform 3 word anagram searches but generally these will return huge number of matches.

title: Cr.ssw.rd Phrase
subtitle: Use . for unknown letters
description: The app contains 100,000 common sayings and famous names. Use a space to separate the words and dots(.) for unknown letters
advanced: You only need one or two letters for the app to find only a few possible answers, a great way to start your crossword off.

title: Crossword Shortcuts
subtitle: Use numbers for multiple unknowns
description: For crossword answers with lots of unknown letters, you can use numbers to save on typing, eg type z9 instead of z.........
example: motte and bailey, miles per gallon
advanced:
Shortcuts are particularly useful when searching for multi-word crossword answers.

To avoid confusion with Codeword searches, do not use 1 instead of .

title: Supergrams*
subtitle: Use * as one or more blank letters
description: Supergrams will find words that contain all of your letters. Type * after your letters, to tell the app to do a supergram search
advanced:
In the example above, breathtakingly contains the letters kayleigh and brttan.

The app will highlight the extra letters (eg brttan). You can change the highlight colour from the app's settings.

title: Prefix@Suffix
subtitle: Use @ for 1 or more unknown letters
description: A pattern search similar to crosswords where @ represents 1 or more unknown letters
advanced: You can mix . and @ in your search, enter sup@x. to find supergalaxy

title: Codewords
subtitle: Use 1,2,3 to represent the same letters
description:
Codewords (and Cryptograms) are puzzles where you have to work out the letter for each number 1 to 26.

For example 23 18 15 15 9 2 2 9. We can see that 15, 9 and 2 are used more than once which we can make good use of, the app just needs to know which letters are used more than once.

Lets say we know 23 = c, so we enter c.112332, where 1,2,3 represent the unknown letters that are used more than once.
advanced:
As you find letters you can use the Excluding filter and enter the letters you have already found. So in the above example, if we already have p and m then we can rule out pallette and commesse.

If you have no letters that are used more than once, then set the Distinct filter to All letters are different.

Tip! When starting a Codeword, first try the largest word in the grid.

title: $pelling Bee
subtitle: Type $, middle letter and outer letters
description:
Spelling Bee puzzles are where you only use the letters provided, but as many times as you like.

First enter $, then the middle letter and then the surrounding letters.
advanced:
The middle letter must be included in every word found.

Words must be 4 or more letters long.
